directions.dialogText: In this activity, we are going to create functions. In levels 1-5, we will write a \`jumpAsteroid()\` function that will allow the Space Ranger to jump over an asteroid and get the part on the other side.

levels.mission: Inside the \`{ }\`s of the \`jumpAsteroid()\` function, write the code that will make the Space Ranger get the part. To run your function, add \`jumpAsteroid()\` under the last \`}\`.
levels.tools:
\`move()\` move forward one square

\`rotate()\` rotate 90 degrees

\`getPart()\` pick up a sphere
levels.tips:
Your code should look like this:

     function jumpAsteroid(){
         rotate()
         move()
         getPart()
     }

     jumpAsteroid()

directions.dialogText: Great! Let's keep working on our \`jumpAsteroid()\` function. Add a few more lines to it so the Space Ranger can get the part when it's above the asteroid.

levels.mission: Inside the \`{ }\`s of the \`jumpAsteroid()\` function, add code that will make the Space Ranger get the part in its new location.
levels.tools:
\`move()\` move forward one square

\`rotate()\` rotate 90 degrees

\`getPart()\` pick up a sphere
levels.tips:
Your code should look like this:

     function jumpAsteroid(){
         rotate()

         rotate()
         rotate()
         rotate()
         move()
         getPart()
     }

     jumpAsteroid()

workspace.codeSpace:
function jumpAsteroid(){
    rotate()
    move()
    rotate()
    rotate()
    rotate()
    move()
    getPart()
}

jumpAsteroid()

directions.dialogText: Excellent! But when we try to jump two asteroids in a row, it doesn't work. Can you add one more line to the \`jumpAsteroid()\` function to fix the problem?

levels.mission: Inside the \`{ }\`s of the \`jumpAsteroid()\` function, add one line of code that will allow the Space Ranger to jump two asteroids in a row.

directions.dialogText: You did it! Now that our \`jumpAsteroid()\` function works for two asteroids, there's no reason it won't work for three. Can you jump three asteroids by only adding one line of code?

levels.mission: Add just one line of code to make the Space Ranger jump three asteroids in a row.

directions.dialogText: Now that you know how to create a function, let's try a new one called \`upStair()\`. Between the \`{ }\`s, add code to make the Space Ranger get the part. Don't forget to call the function after you create it!

directions.dialogText: Houston, we have a problem! When we try to use multiple \`upStair()\` and \`downStair()\` calls, it doesn't work. Can you fix the problem with only one line of code?

levels.mission: Add one line of code to the \`downStair()\` function to fix the code.
levels.tools:
\`move()\` move forward one square

\`rotate()\` rotate 90 degrees

\`getPart()\` pick down a sphere

     }

         move()
         rotate()
         rotate()
         rotate()
         move()
         getPart()
         rotate()
     }

    upStair()
    upStair()
    downStair()
    downStair()

directions.dialogText: Great! Now let's use our \`upStair()\` and \`downStair()\` functions to navigate the asteroid field and collect all the parts!
